alert.note: Alert for Jack; Palo Pinto; Parker; Wise (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 2:18AM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Wise, Jack, northwestern Parker and northeastern Palo Pinto Counties through 245 AM CST... At 217 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles southeast of Windthorst to near Graford. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mineral Wells, Bridgeport, Jacksboro, Chico, Graford, Bryson, Poolville, Boonsville, Mineral Wells State Park, Newport, Runaway Bay and Lake Bridgeport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CST for north central Texas.
